solution_line_template: As Johnny and his son are humans, and humans walk on two legs, this means that between the two of them there are {num_humans}*{human_legs}=<<{num_humans}*{human_legs}={human_legs_total}>>{human_legs_total} legs' worth of organisms.
There are two dogs walking along as well, and since dogs walk on 4 legs this means there are {num_dogs}*{dog_legs}=<<{num_dogs}*{dog_legs}={dog_legs_total}>>{dog_legs_total} legs' worth of organisms.
We add these two totals together to find there are {human_legs_total}+{dog_legs_total}=<<{human_legs_total}+{dog_legs_total}={total_legs}>>{total_legs} legs' worth of organisms in total.
